2.text: Pour 2 cups (256 g) of white flour into a mixing bowl.

3.text: Mix in 1 cup (240 ml) of water into the flour.

4.text: Knead the dough into a ball.

5.text: Roll the dough until it’s 1⁄4 inch (0.64 cm) thick.

6.text: Cut the dough into 3 in (7.6 cm) x 3 in (7.6 cm) squares.

7.text: Poke evenly-spaced holes in straight lines in each cracker.

8.text: Lay the crackers out on a baking sheet.

9.text: Bake the hardtack for 30 minutes on each side.

10.text: Transfer the crackers into an airtight container after they've cooled.

11.text: Store the crackers in a cool area away from direct sunlight.

12.text: Mix in some spices for extra flavor.

13.text: Include ¼ cup (85 g) of coconut oil in your recipe for more sweetness.

14.text: Pour 1 tbsp (21.5 g) of honey into the dough.

15.text: Substitute white flour with sorghum flour for a sweeter flavor.
